title: [BUG] Unable to Build an Azure ML Container Image for an MLflow model
body:
I am unable to build an Azure ML Container Image for an MLflow model. While building the docker image using the code:

azure_image, azure_model = mlflow.azureml.build_image(model_uri="<model_uri path>", workspace=<azure_workspace>, synchronous=True)

Getting the following error in the log:

Step 9/13 : RUN pip install mlflow==1.24.0
 ---> Running in c52dae9d410a
[91mERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement mlflow==1.24.0 (from versions: 0.0.1, 0.1.0, 0.2.0, 0.2.1, 0.3.0, 0.4.0, 0.4.1, 0.4.2, 0.5.0, 0.5.1, 0.5.2, 0.6.0, 0.7.0, 0.8.0, 0.8.1, 0.8.2, 0.9.0, 0.9.0.1, 0.9.1, 1.0.0, 1.1.0, 1.1.1.dev0, 1.2.0, 1.3.0, 1.4.0, 1.5.0, 1.6.0, 1.7.0, 1.7.1, 1.7.2, 1.8.0, 1.9.0, 1.9.1, 1.10.0, 1.11.0, 1.12.0, 1.12.1, 1.13, 1.13.1, 1.14.0, 1.14.1, 1.15.0, 1.16.0, 1.17.0, 1.18.0, 1.19.0, 1.20.0, 1.20.1, 1.20.2, 1.21.0, 1.22.0, 1.23.0, 1.23.1)
[0m[91mERROR: No matching distribution found for mlflow==1.24.0


Also, I noticed that the python image being used is a python-slim while building the image:

Step 1/13 : FROM mcr.microsoft.com/azureml/o16n-base/python-slim:latest.westeurope
latest.westeurope: Pulling from azureml/o16n-base/python-slim

Could that also be a reason. If yes, how do we specify the python version while building the image?
